markdownRemark.html:
If you use VS code, there is a built in terminal in there. But sometimes its needed to use regular terminal (for example inital VS Code open). And what I usually type is code . && exit. The inconvenience is to reach & key xD. For me it’s annoying so I wrote a little zsh func for this. Just add it to your ~/.zshrc

# open current dir (if not specified) in VS code and exit the terminal
codeandexit() {
    if [ "$1" != "" ]
    then
        code "$1"
    else
        code .
    fi
    exit
}

frontmatter.title: Custom zsh command
frontmatter.description: Custom zsh command to open dir in VS Code and exit terminal
